byline.original: By ALEXANDER BURNS and CHARLIE SAVAGE

abstract: New Jersey Gov Chris Christie's record as state's top federal prosecutor from 2002 to 2008 indicates he acquired more counterterrorism experience than his rivals in presidential race, but also reveals he may have spun his narrative; close examination of files shows Christie overstated heft of terrorism prosecutions he oversaw, and seems to have exaggerated his personal role.
lead_paragraph: An examination of Gov. Chris Christie’s record as New Jersey’s top federal prosecutor shows that he has, at times, overstated the significance of the terrorism prosecutions he oversaw.

headline.main: Christie Spins His Version of Security Record on Trail
headline.print_headline: Christie Spins His Narrative of Security Record on the Trail

snippet: An examination of Gov. Chris Christie’s record as New Jersey’s top federal prosecutor shows that he has, at times, overstated the significance of the terrorism prosecutions he oversaw.
